item.title: Neverness to Everness from Tower of Fantasy Devs Gets April Release Date
item.content:encoded:
Developer Hotta Studio and publisher Perfect World have revealed the Neverness to Everness release date, and it'll only be a couple of months before you get to decide whether there's room for another gacha RPG in your rotation.

In a message on social media, the two studios reveal that Neverness to Everness will be landing on April 29th "with full cross-platform support", so just like some of the genre's other heavy hitters, you'll be able to pick up where you left off on other platforms.

Perfect World and Hotta Studio also implore fans to help them reach their pre-registration goals, which will see a range of prizes handed out to players if they're met. Neverness to Everness has already reached 25 million pre-registrations, so there will already be some goodies waiting for you if you do decide to play.

If you're not familiar with Neverness to Everness, it's another free-to-play gacha RPG from the people who brought you Tower of Fantasy, so you should know roughly what to expect from this one if you've played that.

Originally revealed back in July 2024, Neverness to Everness is one of two upcoming gacha action RPGs that foregrounds a modern urban fantasy-style setting with an emphasis on vehicle mechanics, strangely enough.

The game will cast you as an Appraiser (thus handily giving Perfect World and Hotta Studio a pithy name for their community as well), tasked with investigating a series of anomalies across the land of Hethereau.

You can check out an extended gameplay trailer for Neverness to Everness right here if you want to get a sense for what kind of game awaits you in April.

Neverness to Everness is set to land on PC, PlayStation 5, and mobile devices on April 29th. Stay tuned for more on this one and all other things gacha RPG-related.

item.title: Disgaea Mayhem Brings Over-the-Top Action This Summer
item.content:encoded:
Publisher NIS America has announced Disgaea Mayhem, which, as the name suggests, is a spinoff of the popular Disgaea strategy RPG series, and it's coming to PC and consoles this summer.

As revealed via a new trailer, Disgaea Mayhem will land on PC, PS5, and both Switch machines sometime later this year (sorry, Xbox owners). It marries Disgaea's signature silly style with more kinetic and action-foucsed gameplay.

Per the newly-released Steam page for Disgaea Mayhem, the game will cast you as N.A., a mercenary hired by a princess in order to help her, erm, eat as much sweet stuff as she can. It's classic off-the-wall Disgaea fare.

Disgaea Mayhem will offer seven different classes for you to play as, each based on classic Disgaea weapons like swords, guns, and axes, and you can switch between them at any time you like.

This being Disgaea, you can, of course, also look forward to two series staples in Mayhem: absurd grind and ludicrously over-the-top damage numbers.

NIS America says the game will feature the chance to "grind levels, improve your equipment, and...make the numbers go up until you're dealing a million damage with every hit", which sounds like Disgaea alright.

You can take a look at the debut trailer for Disgaea Mayhem, which shows off what you can expect from this new spinoff's gameplay (as well as its classic art style), right here.

Being a spinoff, Disgaea Mayhem isn't part of the mainline Disgaea series; the latest core title to be released is still 2023's seventh installment, although judging by the past release cadence for the series, we shouldn't be too far off Disgaea 8.

In the meantime, however, you can check out Disgaea Mayhem when it lands on PC, PlayStation 5, and both Switch 2 and Switch this summer. Stay tuned for more.
